item.title: Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

What will you do? 

  • Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
  • Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
  • Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
  • Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
  • Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
  • Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
  • Analyze and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have:

  • Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
  • Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
  • Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
  • Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
  • Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

Nice to have:

  • Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
  • Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
  • Experience with .Net.
  • Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Capital Markets

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-05-02-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-10-28-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Job Summary

Address:

New York, New York, United States of America

City:

USA-NY-NEW YORK

Country:

United States of America

40

Full time

item.title: Marketing Analytics Manager
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Marketing Analytics Manager

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Manager of Marketing Analytics, you will be joining the Performance Marketing Centre of Excellence within RBCx to lead the creation and implementation of an ideal analytics framework, supporting several ventures in a startup culture, rich with fast-thinking and a quick-to-market mindset; and also working closely with our teams in Royal Bank of Canada, one of Canada’s largest banks.

The ideal candidate should have the interest and ability to take on highly advanced measurement implementations in a hands on fashion. You will work across our portfolio of mobile applications, mobile web applications, desktop web properties, and work within social platforms (e.g., Facebook) to ensure data is accurately captured and actioned appropriately within our marketing analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Appsflyer). With RBCx Ventures being a newer division of RBC, you have the opportunity to create and build upon a foundation that will shape the future growth of our businesses, and RBC.

What will you do?

  • Establish and implement proper marketing analytics standards and measurement plans analytical standards across multiple ventures/businesses to ensure all teams are set up for success when it comes to data collection and venture analysis.
  • Setup, maintain, and implement all tagging requirements across both mobile app/web and desktop web properties using Google Tag Manager and/or Javascript code
  • Provide technical support to internal and partner teams surrounding analytics tagging, data validation and data integration
  • Identify and implement all tagging requirements across both mobile app/web and desktop web properties
  • Assess and implement growth optimization tools such as Google Optimize, Unbounce and other A/B testing tools to improve & optimize on-site content
  • Guide and support key stakeholders in the appropriate implementation and validation of new tagging requirements and fixes, as well as ensuring existing tracking remains intact.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Readily sharable experience implementing analytical systems regardless of platform.
  • 3-5 years of digital analytics implementation or relevant experience
  • Experience with Tag Management tools such as Google Tag Manager, Segment, Tealium, others
  • Experience implementing web and advertising analytics tools such as Google Analytics 360, Appsflyer, Facebook Analytics, Google Optimize, Google Ads and others
  • Hands on experience coding in JavaScript events and jQuery as well as best practices for JavaScript coding
  • Paid advertising integrations i.e. App Conversion Events Integrations

Nice-to-have

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or an International equivalent

  • Familiarity with front end SPA frameworks such as Angular and React preferred Web application programming experience (PHP, Java, Ruby, etc.) preferred Debugging techniques and tools for front end web development

  • Project Tracking software experience (Asana, Jira)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Supports the development and maintenance of scalable data stores that supply big data in forms needed for business analysis. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Canada

Ventures

item.title: Manager, Credit Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Credit Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This is a highly technical role requiring hands-on experience with data and decisioning tools to provide support to the credit strategy partners to execute direct marketing campaigns and initiatives. This role will continuously challenge and seek to improve the efficiency and accuracy of risk eligible rules and strategy implementation design and processes utilizing new technologies and data sources.

What will you do?

  • Design, build, and test strategy changes in various platforms to ensure flawless implementation
  • Complete quality assurance audits to ensure the design & build has been accurately interpreted to meets the business need
  • Strong in data analysis and data sciences
  • Develops clearly written documentation for strategy changes that are tailored to different audiences including business groups, QA, IT and senior management
  • Seeks opportunities to utilize RBC data sources to develop automation of execution and testing activities. Identifies and implements new methods or processes to shorten the execution cycle or to reduce costs
  • Ensure that strategy implementation standard methodology and best practices are implemented in day to day routines

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 3+ years expertise in relational database marketing and structured programming concepts, including the use of data analytics and decisioning tools (e.g., SAS, SQL, Python, SPARK)
  • 3+ years’ experience in application of experimental design
  • Strong data analytical skillsets and mind-set
  • Strong project management, time management and implementation skills
  • Strong problem resolution and decision-making skills
  • Strong written/oral communication skills to develop and convey thoughtful and insightful explanations

item.title: Manager - Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager - Data Analytics

Job Description

Manager, Data Analytics

What is the opportunity?

As Manager, Data Analytics, you will analyze, design and implement data analytics solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools.  As well assist with the development and execution of data analytics, data visualization and reporting implementation within the internal audit function in support of becoming an insight driven organization.  Work with structured and unstructured data to further enable a risk-based audit approach and help identify impacts to the organization’s internal control environment leveraging automated and self-served capabilities.
 

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

What will you do?  

  • Data Curation & Statistics: Curate, prepare and wrangle data to test business hypotheses.

  • Technology: Prepare and integrate large and varied datasets and deploy production grade solutions.

  • Domain Knowledge: Collaborate with business partners to produce insights from business-defined requirements and hypotheses.

  • Communication & Visualization: Effectively communicate findings to business partners.  Leverage advanced visualization tools to create powerful representations of results.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong experience working as a Business / Technical Systems Analyst in a highly analytical environment.

  • Expert experience in data analytics cycle (data gathering, transformation, modeling, analytics, and reporting).

  • Strong knowledge and experience with traditional database technology (i.e. SQL) and a fundamental understanding of data flow and handling.

  • Expert coding skills with Python/R.

  • Experience with data visualization libraries (e.g. plotly, ggplot, seaborn, Shiny, Dash).

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Associate, Profitability and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Profitability and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Associate, Profitability and Analytics will establish, track and report business metrics across profitability, opportunity, risk and supervisory. In this role, will create client and market insights driven by profitability metrics to inform future path using a data and commercially led approach to establish profitability benchmarks and hurdle rates by product, service bundles and clients as the team shifts additional focus and resources to analytics to support Executive Management directives.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for profitability evaluation, execution, and analysis on products and clients as well as other analysis across multiple client segments and categories
  • Consume and integrate multiple data points into simple and clear data driven insights
  • Lead data and market driven analytics to support profit decisions, develops recommendations for profit improvement, and provides support for the execution
  • Partner across the organization to proactively identify areas of profit opportunity for new & existing products
  • Develop a thorough understanding of profitability models, identify enhancements needed and support partners in implementation
  • Provide analysis of profitability impact on actions implemented across products and clients
  • Support the Pricing team on repricing/new pricing requests
  • Collaborate with product leads and Pricing team in developing and refining standard rate schedules
  • Responsible for enforcing best-in-class profitability processes including data consistency and presentment.
  • Partner with Product, Business Development, and Client Success groups to collaboratively design profit strategies & market plans to then track and translate into financial results
  • Proactive identification of new revenue and profit expansion opportunities by the use of analytics and develop and lead look back analysis on recent client deals with input from various Stakeholder (Client Success, Product, Pricing, Business Development)
  • Elevate and increase the visibility of profitability and ensure key participants in the Client Success, Product and Business Development have profitability considerations top of mind.
  • Continually emphasis to key stakeholders about the importance of using business case financials as a tool to aid in the decision making process for new and existing business. Provide innovation of commercial models that can be applied according to different situations
  • Owner of the group’s policies and procedures library. Group representative on RBC’s PPL Governance Committee to ensure group adheres to RBC’s current policy and procedures rules and adapts any changes in the near future

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • University or post-graduate degree in Business, Economics or Finance.
  • High level of numeracy and experience in financial analysis  (Proven quality control skills to ensure Data Accuracy and strong business modeling and financial analytics skills)
  • Demonstrated ability to understand key drivers of financial performance and magnitude of impact
  • Proven self-starter with ability to identify and act on opportunities to drive change leading to  better financial outcomes
  • Strong organizational skills, independent prioritization
  • Ability to anticipate partner needs and make decisions in the face of ambiguity
  • Proficient in the MS Office suite of products with expertise in Excel
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with particular emphasis on the ability to translate between technical and business terminology, and to formulate clear actionable insights
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good working relationships within and across business units at all levels of seniority
  • Exceptional sense of urgency, and attention to detail and accuracy
  • Comfortable liaising with senior management and executives
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • Prior experience in the securities industry and/or in RBC I&TS in related functions
  • Exposure to RBC I&TS core products/systems
  • CFA, MBA or other professional accounting/finance designation

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Investor and Treasury Services

Regular

Salaried

item.title: Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will have the opportunity to apply analytics to the point of client interaction with the Digital Products of RBC.  You will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle: data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations. 

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure and complete analyses, uncover insights, develop net new data assets, and build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 5+ years of experience in related digital product development, data analyst or data mining role
  • Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm for advancing digital analytics and products
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala and PowerPoint
  • Experience with Jupyter Notebooks, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau or comparable data visualization tools
  • Hands-on knowledge of agile methodologies Github and JIRA
  • Structured thinking: developing an end-to-end analysis plans to tackle ambiguous and open-ended business problems
  • Stakeholder management skills: ability to inform and influence stakeholders through data, build relationships, communicate early and often
  • High agency: figuring out a way to get the job done, pushing through in the face of imperfect conditions or managing to reverse adverse conditions to achieve goals

Nice-to-have

  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Design, oversee and deliver analytics on client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use data mining and a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights
    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support product development strategies and drive decisions
    • Help implement re-usable analytics frameworks for use across Digital data
  • Data Collection/ Ingestions/ Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
  • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
  • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities
  • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Actively support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Manage stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with progress on deliverables
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

item.title: Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Design and develop innovative reporting solutions to monitor operational performance, present insights to underlying drivers, and support leaders in managing their business
  • Source data from various platforms and build automated data pipelines
  • Lead conversations with business partners to solicit requirements and project feedback
  • Apply standard design principles and advanced data visualization techniques to provide actionable insights
  • Test and validate new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Advanced proficiency in developing reports using Tableau
  • Proven innovative mindset with quantitative analytical and problem solving skills
  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports (e.g. MSSQL, Teradata, HDFS)
  • Demonstrated capabilities with Python or other automation technologies (e.g. Datameer)
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leadership in order to inform strategic decisions
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently
  • A team player who is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback when needed

Nice-to-have

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • Experience with technologies such as GitHub, Jira, general APIs
  • Project management capabilities

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?
RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence is hiring a Manager, Workforce & Transformation Analytics role that will lead strategic insights for CBO by utilizing cutting edge technologies to drive digital operations. The position plays a key role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing and financial modelling
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies and playbooks
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field is preferred but not required (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.)
  • Previous experience in a Finance role (Corporate Treasury, Funds Transfer Pricing)
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity models

Job Summary

As the Senior Manager, Pricing and Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and management of pricing strategies to drive profitable growth and increased market share for the Personal Lending (PL) portfolios. The Senior Manager of Pricing and Analytics is responsible for the development and end-to-end implementation of pricing strategies, including providing actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

item.title: Director, Business Insights & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Business Insights & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will lead a team of analytics professionals in designing qualitative and quantitative strategies to drive the Advice Centre Transformation Program, sales plans and employee performance, to optimize the client experience through targeted business and client insights.  You will work with CB Operations and Product strategies, Business Enablement and Advice Centre leaders to enable business intelligence including performance, productivity and client satisfaction results against plan and identify areas of risk, opportunity and success.  You will lead the delivery of insights and ensure optimal deployment of resources  to support the dual objectives and strategies of Winning for Today and informing the strategies and priorities of Transforming for tomorrow. You will manage requests to ensure alignment to strategic priorities, business needs and financial imperatives.  And, you will develop an engaged and high performing team.

What will you do?

  • Apply a strong business acumen, understanding of deep data and exceptional communication skills to translate and interpret complex analysis into actionable and consumable insights Identify strategic opportunities to improve CX, employee engagement, optimize multi-channel capabilities, drive operational efficiencies and develop new methods to present analytical insights to a diverse stakeholder audience  
  • Develop AC sales forecast & modelling and Client Experience (CX) benchmarks leveraging analytics/data to identify new opportunities to drive efficiencies in the AC
  • Identify drivers of workload for waterfall analysis and to inform business strategies, and research opportunities to apply robotic process automation solutions to existing processes
  • Develop effective methodologies to analyze and predict Advice Centre (AC) business performance and uncover insights to enable the AC leadership team to implement action plans to achieve/exceed business objectives
  • Lead a team to continue leveraging speech and text analytics to identify drivers of client experience and quantify their impact to support prioritization discussions with product and megajourney partners
  • Develop an integrated engagement/on-boarding process to anticipate priorities and right channel business needs, ensuring analytical expertise is deployed towards strategic priorities, with a focus on automating, where suitable
  • Lead the execution, discovery and presentation of insights for prioritized analytical deep dives, to support business performance enablement and transformation programs

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 5+ years Canadian Banking experience and an understanding of RBC products and services
  • Demonstrated proactive leadership experience, including leading teams and leading in a cross functional environment
  • Proven and analytical capabilities, with the ability to interpret meaning and inferences from data, tell a story and pitch business cases
  • Able to review and understand text and speech analytics and applications
  • Ability to interact and collaborate effectively with stakeholders enterprise-wide, identify and deliver powerful insights
  • Knowledge of internal RBC applications and procedures and data
  • Strong facilitation and presentation skills, to engage and maintain a presence with senior leaders
  • Change leadership capability in identifying opportunity and driving transformation in Advice Centres
  • Ability to motivate and develop talent on the team
  • Understanding of the sales function and an advisor’s capabilities

Nice-to-have

  • Zero based costing experience
  • Operational or financial analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team 
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
